alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 5:59PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL ROOSEVELT, EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL, SOUTH CENTRAL HARDING, CENTRAL QUAY AND CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM MDT... At 558 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Glenrio to 6 miles east of Oasis State Park. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Tucumcari, Texico, Logan, Melrose, San Jon, Floyd, Grady and Saint Vrain. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 332 and 373. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 361 and 397. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 104 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern and east central New Mexico.
